title: Filing Status Basics Assessment

questions.question: Which filing status applies to an unmarried taxpayer supporting a dependent?
questions.explanation: Head of Household status is for unmarried taxpayers who pay more than half the cost of keeping up a home for a qualifying person.

questions.question: Which document reports wage income to an employee?
questions.explanation: Form W-2 reports wages, salaries, and tips paid to employees by their employers.

questions.question: A dependent must always be under age 18.
questions.explanation: Dependents can be qualifying children (under 19, or under 24 if full-time student) or qualifying relatives (no age limit).

questions.question: Which filing status generally results in the lowest tax liability for married couples?
questions.explanation: Married Filing Jointly typically offers the most favorable tax rates and deductions for married couples.

questions.question: What is the maximum age for a qualifying child dependent who is NOT a full-time student?
questions.explanation: A qualifying child must be under 19 at the end of the tax year (or under 24 if a full-time student).

questions.question: A taxpayer can claim themselves as a dependent on their own return.
questions.explanation: Taxpayers cannot claim themselves as dependents. They claim personal exemptions (pre-TCJA) or standard deductions.

questions.question: Which of the following is a requirement for Head of Household filing status?
options: Must pay more than half the cost of maintaining a home
questions.correct_answer: Must pay more than half the cost of maintaining a home
questions.explanation: To qualify for Head of Household, you must be unmarried and pay more than half the costs of keeping up a home for yourself and a qualifying person.

questions.question: Married couples can always choose to file separately without any consequences.
questions.explanation: While married couples can file separately, this often results in higher tax rates and loss of certain tax credits and deductions.

questions.question: What is the IRS test for determining if someone is a qualifying relative?
questions.explanation: The qualifying relative test includes: relationship, gross income (under threshold), support (you provide >50%), and other requirements.

questions.question: A dependent's Social Security Number must be included on the tax return.
questions.explanation: You must provide a valid SSN or ITIN for each dependent claimed on your tax return.

instructor_notes: Review common errors: Head of Household vs Single status confusion, dependent age limits, and support test calculations. Emphasize IRS Publication 501 as reference.
